MapModuleNotice Class Reference

Objects of this class is used by the MapModule to keep track of all existing maps without having to have all of them loaded. More...

#include <MapModuleNotice.h>

Private Attributes

  • GfxData * m_gfxData
    GfxData of the map, usefull when looking for what map to ask for when looking for the closest item to a coordinate.
  • MC2BoundingBox m_bbox
    Bounding box for the GfxData.
  • set< uint32 > m_neighbourMaps
    mapIDs of the neighbour maps.

  • char * m_mapName
    Name of the map.

Static Private Attributes

  • const char * countryNamePrefix
    Country map name prefix.

Detailed Description

Objects of this class is used by the MapModule to keep track of all existing maps without having to have all of them loaded.

Definition at line 31 of file MapModuleNotice.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

MapModuleNotice::MapModuleNotice (  uint32  mapID = MAX_UINT32,
GfxData *  mapGfxData = NULL,
uint32  creationTime = MAX_UINT32
) 
 

Creates a MapModuleNotice according to the specifications.

Parameters:
mapID The map id this MapModuleNotice describes.
mapGfxData The graphical description of the boundry of the map. Will not be copied.
creationTime The time when the map was created. Nice to know when cacheing.

MapModuleNotice::MapModuleNotice (  DataBuffer *  dataBuffer,
int  version = 0,
uint32  mapSet = MAX_UINT32
) 
 

Creates a MapModuleNotice from a DataBuffer.

Useful when loading from disk.

Parameters:
dataBuffer Where to get the rawdata of this MapModuleNotice.
version Version of index.db. If version > 0 the MapModuleNotice will also have a version.
mapSet The Map set ID to use, MAX_UINT32 is default and means ignore

virtual MapModuleNotice::~MapModuleNotice (   )  [virtual]
 

Deletes this MapModuleNotice and returns the allocated memory.

Returns the name of the map.

Used when creating maps and top regions. Can also be used for nicer debugging messages.

The name of the map.

Definition at line 242 of file MapModuleNotice.h.

uint32 MapModuleNotice::getSizeInDataBuffer (  int  version = 0  )  const
 

NB! This method adds 4 in order to compensate for alignment, i.e.

it does not return the extact size.

Tells how large the notice is in when saved in a databuffer.

Returns:
The size of the notice in a data buffer.

int  version = 0
) 
 

Saves this MapModuleNotice to disk.

Parameters:
dataBuffer Where the MapNotice is to be stored.
Returns:
True if this MapModuleNotice saved ok, false otherwise.

Definition at line 190 of file MapModuleNotice.h.

MC2BoundingBox MapModuleNotice::m_bbox [private]
 

Bounding box for the GfxData.

The getBoundingBox-method of GfxData is slow so we create the bbox when loading.
